kibahop - (10:15): Hi. I Installed from xwiki-enterprise-installer-generic-2.1-standard.jar. Now when I import applications, like bulletin board or mindmap, all the link labels seem to be missing. E.g. I see bb\_addnewcategory... Instead of Add New Category (I think). Any quick info on this? Thanks.   
arkub joined #xwiki at 10:20  
xwiki-bridge - (10:21): [glerouge] kibahop: that's because you forgot to register translation pages  
xwiki-bridge - (10:22): [glerouge] kibahop: look at Step 2 on http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Applications/BulletinBoardApplicationDownloads#HHowtoinstall  
kibahop - (10:31): glerouge: Works. I was too anxious. Thanks.   
xwiki-bridge - (10:39): [glerouge] kibahop: :)  
xwiki-bridge - (10:49): [tmortagne] guys, what don't you think of skipping Scheduler.WatchList\*Notifier from the notification log here ? It's more spam than anything right now...  
xwiki-bridge - (10:49): [Vincent Massol] tmortagne: fine with me  
xwiki-bridge - (10:50): [jvdrean] tmortagne: very fine with me  
xwiki-bridge - (10:50): [tmortagne] ok doing it now then  
xwiki-bridge - (10:52): [tmortagne] Vincent Massol: how do i reiester again the bit when i modifed it ? "Unregister" button turn to "Register" when i click on it ?  
xwiki-bridge - (10:52): [Vincent Massol] yes  
xwiki-bridge - (10:52): [tmortagne] bot  
xwiki-bridge - (10:52): [tmortagne] ok  
xwiki-bridge - (10:57): [tmortagne] jvdrean: i only have to skip theses pages on the main wiki right ?  
xwiki-bridge - (10:59): [jvdrean] tmortagne: yes  
xwiki-bridge - (10:59): [Vincent Massol] sdumitriu: I think I've found an important bug  
xwiki-bridge - (10:59): [Vincent Massol] with the ajax save  
xwiki-bridge - (10:59): [Vincent Massol] I was on my blog (massol.myxwiki.org) and I was creating a new blog entry  
xwiki-bridge - (11:00): [Vincent Massol] I hit save&continue  
xwiki-bridge - (11:00): [tmortagne] jvdrean: ok thanks  
xwiki-bridge - (11:00): [Vincent Massol] and then hit cancel  
xwiki-bridge - (11:00): [Vincent Massol] when I did this there was the message that the doc doesn't not exist

xwiki-bridge - (11:05): [Vincent Massol] test2  
xwiki-bridge - (11:06): [Vincent Massol] hmmm  
xwiki-bridge - (11:06): [Vincent Massol] it's a good bot, it only answers to its master :)  
xwiki-bridge - (11:06): [Vincent Massol] it's working fine now it seems  
xwiki-bridge - (11:06): [tmortagne] :)  
xwiki-bridge - (11:06): [Vincent Massol] I don't know why though

xwiki-bridge - (11:20): [Vincent Massol] ok that would explain it

xwiki-bridge - (14:20): [NielsMayer] why do i need to do this? "#set( $rcDoc = $xwiki.getDocument("Scheduler.WebHome") )  #if( ${rcDoc.hasAccessLevel("view")} ) #set( $docEpoch = $rcDoc.date.getTime() ) xwiki.formatDate($rcDoc.date) #else {{error}}Can not access Scheduler.WebHome{{/error}} #end    -------- what is special about Scheduler.WebHome (and other docs in Scheduler) that non-admin users can't get its creation date just because it's not  
xwiki-bridge - (14:20): [NielsMayer] viewable?  
xwiki-bridge - (14:20): [NielsMayer] ^^ XE 2.1  
xwiki-bridge - (14:33): [sdumitriu] WDYM?  
xwiki-bridge - (14:33): [sdumitriu] The document is not accessible, what's wrong with that?  
xwiki-bridge - (14:42): [Vincent Massol] tmortagne: do we need a 2.1.1 ASAP for the attachment deletion issue?  
xwiki-bridge - (14:43): [tmortagne] not sure it's that critical (attachment is really deleted and delete attachment is not that common)  
xwiki-bridge - (14:44): [Vincent Massol] what's the pb from the user pov (not sure I understand)  
xwiki-bridge - (14:44): [Vincent Massol] ?  
xwiki-bridge - (14:44): [Vincent Massol] (oterhwise attachment deletion is quite common)

xwiki-bridge - (14:52): [tmortagne] it's possible the list is correct when you restart XWiki but otherwise yes the attachment satay in the list even if it doe snot exists  
xwiki-bridge - (14:52): [Vincent Massol] sounds pretty important to me  
xwiki-bridge - (14:52): [Vincent Massol] question: why do we have so many things scheduled for 2.1.1?  
xwiki-bridge - (14:52): [Vincent Massol] http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI/fixforversion/11359  
xwiki-bridge - (14:52): [Vincent Massol] looks like a bug  
xwiki-bridge - (14:52): [tmortagne] Vincent Massol: it's not minor, i just say i doubt we need 2.1.1 right now just for that  
xwiki-bridge - (14:52): [Vincent Massol] we have 6 issues fixed already  
xwiki-bridge - (14:52): [tmortagne] now 2.1.1 release is JV job so if he want to do it ok for me ;)  
xwiki-bridge - (14:53): [Vincent Massol] but I'm wondering why there are so many issues planned for 2.1.1  
xwiki-bridge - (14:53): [jvdrean] indeed it's not minor, +1 to release 2.1.1 before the end of the week  
xwiki-bridge - (14:53): [tmortagne] i guess it's not really issues planned for 2.1.1 but more "i don't have time to finish for 2.1 let put it in 2.1.1" issues  
xwiki-bridge - (14:54): [sdumitriu] Vincent Massol: "establishing XWiki as one of the best open source enterprise wiki"  
xwiki-bridge - (14:54): [Vincent Massol] tmortagne: sure but normally we push for the next major not the next bug fix release  
xwiki-bridge - (14:54): [sdumitriu] I'd say it's one of the best enterprise wikis, OS or not  
xwiki-bridge - (14:54): [Vincent Massol] maybe we could clean them  
xwiki-bridge - (14:54): [Vincent Massol] according to what we really expect to do, i.e move them to 2.2 IMO   
xwiki-bridge - (14:55): [Vincent Massol] sdumitriu: yes, I agree, I'll change it  
xwiki-bridge - (14:55): [Vincent Massol] "one of" is an easy formula.... ;)  
xwiki-bridge - (14:55): [Vincent Massol] one of the best wiki would work too  
xwiki-bridge - (14:55): [tmortagne] most of the issues seems not assigned, i guess it has been move automatically when 2.1 jira project has been released  
xwiki-bridge - (14:56): [jvdrean] not automatically :)  
xwiki-bridge - (14:56): [jvdrean] I've done a first filtering even if there are some leftovers  
plunden joined #xwiki at 15:05  
Enygma` left at 15:16 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out)

xwiki-bridge - (15:34): [Vincent Massol] anyone has tried it?  
xwiki-bridge - (15:35): [Vincent Massol] if that's the case we should fix it and release 2.1.1 with it too

xwiki-bridge - (15:38): [glerouge] most likely yes  
xwiki-bridge - (15:38): [Vincent Massol] yes this one

xwiki-bridge - (15:52): [Jérôme Velociter] the only one that is not in XWiki/ space  
xwiki-bridge - (15:52): [Jérôme Velociter] (ColorThemes class)  
xwiki-bridge - (15:52): [Vincent Massol] it's a rights issue  
xwiki-bridge - (15:52): [Jérôme Velociter] I am logged in as a non admin  
xwiki-bridge - (15:52): [Jérôme Velociter] yep  
xwiki-bridge - (15:53): [Jérôme Velociter] now logging as an admin user it's alright  
xwiki-bridge - (15:53): [Jérôme Velociter] it means our app is flawed  
xwiki-bridge - (15:53): [Vincent Massol] yes I reported it some time ago  
xwiki-bridge - (15:53): [Jérôme Velociter] if users cannot create their download page  
xwiki-bridge - (15:53): [Vincent Massol] I think it was fixed but I'm not 100% sure  
xwiki-bridge - (15:53): [Jérôme Velociter] ok  
xwiki-bridge - (15:53): [Vincent Massol] we need to check  
xwiki-bridge - (15:53): [Vincent Massol] checking  
xwiki-bridge - (15:54): [Vincent Massol] Jérôme Velociter: you can reference the old column macro in an info box and vice-versa  
xwiki-bridge - (15:54): [sdumitriu] About the PDF export  
xwiki-bridge - (15:54): [Jérôme Velociter] Vincent Massol: yep will do that  
xwiki-bridge - (15:54): [sdumitriu] That stacktrace is weird  
xwiki-bridge - (15:54): [sdumitriu] The problem is a broken pipe  
xwiki-bridge - (15:55): [sdumitriu] Broken socket  
kibahop left #xwiki at 15:55  
xwiki-bridge - (15:55): [sdumitriu] It looks like a server issue, not something that we could cause with our code  
xwiki-bridge - (15:55): [glerouge] tmortagne: yes, that's what I meant  
xwiki-bridge - (15:55): [sdumitriu] In Java we can just write data to the socket, there's no method for breaking sockets  
xwiki-bridge - (15:58): [Vincent Massol] Jérôme Velociter: yes I remember I fixed it  
xwiki-bridge - (15:58): [Jérôme Velociter] ok.  
xwiki-bridge - (15:58): [Jérôme Velociter] so it reappeared?  
xwiki-bridge - (15:58): [Vincent Massol] no  
xwiki-bridge - (15:58): [Vincent Massol] xwiki;org hasn't been updated for some time  
xwiki-bridge - (15:58): [Vincent Massol] checking the jira issue  
xwiki-bridge - (15:59): [Vincent Massol] me?  
xwiki-bridge - (15:59): [Jérôme Velociter] ?  
xwiki-bridge - (15:59): [Jérôme Velociter] no  
xwiki-bridge - (15:59): [Vincent Massol] I haven't touched it  
xwiki-bridge - (15:59): [Jérôme Velociter] me:)  
xwiki-bridge - (15:59): [Jérôme Velociter] that's weird  
xwiki-bridge - (15:59): [Jérôme Velociter] have you saved it before ?  
xwiki-bridge - (16:00): [Jérôme Velociter] Created by Jérôme Velociter <http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/JeromeVelociter> on 2009/12/16 15:44  
xwiki-bridge - (16:00): [Jérôme Velociter] Last modified by Vincent Massol <http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/VincentMassol> on 2009/12/16 15:51  
xwiki-bridge - (16:00): [Vincent Massol] yes  
xwiki-bridge - (16:00): [Vincent Massol] I have saved it before  
xwiki-bridge - (16:01): [Vincent Massol] Jérôme Velociter: actually sergiu fixed it : http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XAPANELS-95  
xwiki-bridge - (16:01): [Jérôme Velociter] ok  
xwiki-bridge - (16:01): [Jérôme Velociter] that would be a bug then  
xwiki-bridge - (16:03): [Vincent Massol] Jérôme Velociter: which corresponds to 2.0.3  
xwiki-bridge - (16:03): [Vincent Massol] and xwiki.org is on 2.0.2  
xwiki-bridge - (16:04): [Jérôme Velociter] ok  
xwiki-bridge - (16:04): [Vincent Massol] we should uprgade it to 2.0.5 probably or even 2.1  
xwiki-bridge - (16:04): [Vincent Massol] maybe 2.1.1  
xwiki-bridge - (16:04): [Jérôme Velociter] yep  
xwiki-bridge - (16:04): [Vincent Massol] now that we plan to release it at the end of the week  
xwiki-bridge - (16:04): [Jérôme Velociter] 2.1.1 sounds good  
xwiki-bridge - (16:04): [Vincent Massol] I can fix xwiki.org now though  
xwiki-bridge - (16:05): [Vincent Massol] should be ok now  
xwiki-bridge - (16:07): [Jérôme Velociter] thanks  
xwiki-bridge - (16:35): [Vincent Massol] Jérôme Velociter: re the column macro I don't see a Section macro  
xwiki-bridge - (16:36): [Vincent Massol] btw the naming we have so far is to use 20 at the end of the name I think (eg http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Macros/CodeMacro20)  
CalebJamesDeLisl joined #xwiki at 16:37  
xwiki-bridge - (16:39): [Jérôme Velociter] you mean in the doc/   
xwiki-bridge - (16:39): [Jérôme Velociter] ?  
xwiki-bridge - (16:39): [Vincent Massol] except for http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Macros/Video20Macro which would also need to be fixed  
xwiki-bridge - (16:39): [Vincent Massol] I mean in the page name and thus what appears in the macro page  
xwiki-bridge - (16:39): [Vincent Massol] http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Macros/  
xwiki-bridge - (16:39): [Jérôme Velociter] re the section macro, I'm not sure we need one, do we?  
xwiki-bridge - (16:39): [Vincent Massol] ideally we should choose one way or another and keep it for consistency, no very important, but nicer  
xwiki-bridge - (16:39): [Vincent Massol] Jérôme Velociter: re section how will it work if we don't have one?  
xwiki-bridge - (16:39): [Jérôme Velociter] I mean both are bundled together in the same jar, it's just one feature in the end  
xwiki-bridge - (16:39): [Vincent Massol] in your doc is says you need a section macro  
xwiki-bridge - (16:39): [Vincent Massol] ohhh  
xwiki-bridge - (16:39): [Vincent Massol] that's not clear  
xwiki-bridge - (16:39): [Jérôme Velociter] yes. maybe I should add that  
xwiki-bridge - (16:39): [Vincent Massol] hmmm  
xwiki-bridge - (16:40): [Vincent Massol] better to have 2 entries or have one named "Section & Column Macro" or something like that  
xwiki-bridge - (16:40): [Jérôme Velociter] no, you are not convincing me we need to separate the 2:)  
xwiki-bridge - (16:40): [Jérôme Velociter] yes maybe "section and column" is better name  
xwiki-bridge - (16:40): [Vincent Massol] or section macro  
xwiki-bridge - (16:40): [Vincent Massol] since column is the content of the section macro  
xwiki-bridge - (16:40): [Vincent Massol] what happens when you use the column macro without a section?  
xwiki-bridge - (16:40): [Jérôme Velociter] so that would be SectionAndColumnMacro20  
xwiki-bridge - (16:40): [Jérôme Velociter] I don't know  
xwiki-bridge - (16:40): [Jérôme Velociter] I have to read the code, it's been some time now  
xwiki-bridge - (16:40): [Jérôme Velociter] honestly I  prefer column as name, it makes sense by itself  
xwiki-bridge - (16:40): [Jérôme Velociter] while section I would have doubt of what it is  
xwiki-bridge - (16:41): [Jérôme Velociter] wdyt about I rename to SectionAndColumnMacro20 and explain both are bundled   
xwiki-bridge - (16:41): [Jérôme Velociter] ?  
xwiki-bridge - (16:41): [Vincent Massol] since they are both valid macros, each shyould have its page actually  
xwiki-bridge - (16:41): [Vincent Massol] same as for footnote macros  
xwiki-bridge - (16:42): [Vincent Massol] actuallyt that's a bad example  
xwiki-bridge - (16:42): [Vincent Massol] ;)  
xwiki-bridge - (16:42): [Jérôme Velociter] I'm not so convinced  
xwiki-bridge - (16:42): [Jérôme Velociter] it scatters the documentation  
xwiki-bridge - (16:42): [Vincent Massol] no it's note  
xwiki-bridge - (16:42): [Vincent Massol] not  
xwiki-bridge - (16:42): [Vincent Massol] not really  
xwiki-bridge - (16:42): [Vincent Massol] they are different  
xwiki-bridge - (16:42): [Vincent Massol] if I show you the confluence doc  
xwiki-bridge - (16:42): [Vincent Massol] for both section and column  
xwiki-bridge - (16:42): [Jérôme Velociter] yes but it's one feature in the end  
xwiki-bridge - (16:42): [Vincent Massol] will you be convinced?  
xwiki-bridge - (16:42): [Jérôme Velociter] please do  
xwiki-bridge - (16:42): [Jérôme Velociter] :)  
xwiki-bridge - (16:43): [Vincent Massol] http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Column+Macro  
xwiki-bridge - (16:43): [Vincent Massol] http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Section+Macro  
xwiki-bridge - (16:43): [Vincent Massol] :)  
xwiki-bridge - (16:45): [Jérôme Velociter] honestly not very convinced still
